scene.name: intro
scene.line: I guess we're gonna be here for a minute. Looks like they have a few calls to make.
scene.option: I should probably call someone too.
What are you going to do?

scene.name: ezra-should-call
scene.line: Oh yeah? Who are you calling?
scene.option: I don't know. Just whoever picks up.

scene.name: call-julian
scene.line: Oh, wow. He's got a phone up there? I bet they all share a phone, right? All the birds. `The Big Bird Phone Up In The Sky`.
scene.option: Yep. That's what they call it.
That's ridiculous. He uses the one at the museum.

scene.name: whoever-picks-up
scene.line: Oh, OK. Dialing blind ... you could ruffle some feathers like that, kid, especially this late at night! What would you say to a stranger you can't even see?
scene.option: I ask them if they've seen my folks.
I don't say anything, I just listen.

scene.name: seen-my-folks
scene.line: Oh, OK. Good luck with that.

scene.name: just-listen
scene.line: Huh, OK. I guess you mean well ...

scene.name: what-conway-will-do
scene.line: Yeah, that's a good question. Ha ha. I just thought I'd stretch my legs — you know, on firm ground. I didn't realize this place would be floating on barrels ...

Back when I was driving long hauls — that's the `real big` trucks, now — I sometimes wouldn't leave the cab but to pump gas. I took my meals in there, I slept in there, I changed my socks in there — you know, the whole thing.

So, one time I was hauling a bunch of big spools — telephone wire I think, actually — up from California into Washington state. You know where that is? It's way out, uh ... on a map, it's kinda to the "left" of here ... more or less.

In between California and Washington, there's a place called Oregon, and you can't pump your own gas there! They have a guy who does it called a `gas jockey`, and you'd better not even open your door, or they get all suspicious.

I drove through California and into Washington, and I refueled in the middle, in Oregon. And so I didn't set foot out of my truck for a whole day. When I came out of that cab the ground rushed up like it missed me. Gave me a big old kiss right on the chin, right here.
What I'm saying is ... hell, I forget. Ha ha. What am I talking about?
scene.option: Watch your step getting out of a truck.
You can't pump your own gas in Oregon.

scene.name: lesson
scene.line: Exactly. Don't forget that, and don't say I never taught you anything.

scene.name: conway-leaves
scene.line: Well. Guess I'll head back aboard. Might see if I can find any of the good stuff stashed in the ... maybe in the spice cabinet? Maybe in the medicine cabinet. Ha ha. That's where it belongs ...
Hell, who am I talking to — don't listen to me, kid! I'll see you in a few.
